result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis L Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on Ct. 1.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 2.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with the victims.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 18 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 1.  Jail time will be permanently stayed if all financial obligations are paid in full by 4/20/17. Huber release granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

DC Jail information sheet.

Defendant Curtis L Harris in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
from Atty Pribyl requesting phone appearance for defendant at todays hearing. Court grants request.

Defendant Curtis L Harris appears by phone along with attorney Matthew J Pribyl who appears in person.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Pribyl asks court to set a plea date the middle of February. State has no objection. Court advises defendant he needs to be in court in person for next hearing. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 20, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
Outagamie Co. DA requesting certified copy of bond.

Defendant Curtis L Harris in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Pribyl indicates defendant would like some extra time to prepay fine/costs in order to avoid jail time. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 9/30/16.

Defendant appeared on his own this morning.

Defendant Curtis L Harris in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Defendant Curtis L Harris in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant indicates he appeared on his own earlier today. Atty Pribyl indicates defendant thought his hearing was today, not yesterday. Court cancels warrant. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court  finds probable cause for bindover. State concerned that 3 warrants have been issued on this case before defendant made an initial appearance, requests additional cash bond. Defense gives argument on bond. Court makes statement, not changing bond today, remains in effect as previously set.  Card given to defendant with next court date. Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Pribyl indicates he was recently appointed by PD office. Court reviews events in file. Atty Pribyl hasn't had any contact with defendant. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.
Defendant in custody.
No contact direct or indirect with T.C., The Nautical Inn, K.L. or J.B.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to enter any bars or taverns.

Defendant Curtis L Harris appears by video along with attorney Jeff Cano who appears by phone.  Joan Korb appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant indicates he didn't know about the September 2015 court date. Court questions defendant on current address/employment. State requests cash bond with same conditions. Atty Cano gives bond argument. Atty Cano indicates PD office will be appointing counsel to represent defendant. Bond set. Same conditions apply.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Motion and Order to Withdraw by Atty Schaefer.

Attorney Steven W. Schaefer in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer indicates he's tried to contact defendant and hasn't been able to get in touch with him. Atty Schaefer unsure of defendants whereabouts today. State requests bench warrant. Court order bench warrarnt.

Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
